intro: Galium volcanense, commonly known as the volcanic bedstraw, is a herbaceous plant native to volcanic regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers, which bloom in the summer months. It thrives in nutrient-poor, well-drained soils typical of volcanic landscapes. Galium volcanense is often found in rocky or open areas where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
